first: dr7-18/> Zheng He was also known as "Sanbao" during the time of service in the household of the Prince of Yan.<ref name
last: dr7-1412/> Nevertheless, the Xuande Emperor would eventually come to trust Zheng He.<ref name
pages: Ma Huan Ying Yai Sheng Lan: The overall survey of the ocean shores
postscript: One explanation for the seemingly inefficient size of these colossal ships was that the largest 44 Zhang treasure ships were merely used by the Emperor and imperial bureaucrats to travel along the Yangtze for court business, including reviewing Zheng He's expedition fleet. The Yangtze river, with its calmer waters, may have been navigable by these treasure ships. Zheng He, a court eunuch, would not have had the privilege in rank to command the largest of these ships, seaworthy or not. The main ships of Zheng He's fleet were instead 6 masted 2000-liao ships.<ref name
